content: wrapped in the warmth of rustic charm this hand-knit balaclava is a cozy embrace against the chill the intricate cable detailing adds both texture and timeless elegance the snug yet breathable design drapes gently around the face offering protection from brisk winds while maintaining a soft natural feel perfect for winter wanderers and city strollers alike this hooded beauty blends classic craftsmanship with modern flair making every cold day an opportunity for comfort and style **skill** knitting **difficulty** intermediate **sizes** one size **finished measurements** neck circumference 18 hood depth 9½ **materials** **universal yarn** *dallas* 1 48% merino wool 24% grs cotton 18% polyamide 10% grs polyester 50g/148 yds 105 big sky 2 balls needle us size 9 5 5 mm 16 circular or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle stitch markers cable needle cn stitch holder or waste yarn **gauge** 16 sts x 20 row = 4 in stockinette stitch st st after blocking save time check your gauge **pattern notes** this balaclava is worked seamlessly from the top down starting with a stockinette tab after working the hood flat to the designated length additional stitches are cast on and joined to work the neck in the round stitches picked up around the face opening to work a plaited cable rib the plait rib pattern is written and charted for your convenience 1 https //universalyarn com/products/dallasyarn
